document.masterDocTitle: Ampithoid amphipods from the South Pacific: Papua New Guinea, French Polynesia and New Caledonia

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1.
Ampithoe kava Myers, 1985
, male 5 mm, AM P.82835; female 4 mm, AM P.82836, New Caledonia.

Figure 2.
Ampithoe kava Myers, 1985
, male 5 mm, AM P.82835; female 4 mm, AM P.82836, New Caledonia. Antenna 1 peduncle scale 0.5 mm, all other scales 0.2 mm.

Figure 3.
Ampithoe kava Myers, 1985
, male 5 mm, AM P.82835; female 4 mm, AM P.82836, New Caledonia. Scale bars 0.2 mm.

Figure 4.
Ampithoe kava Myers, 1985
, male 5 mm, AM P.82835; female 4 mm, AM P.82836, New Caledonia. Scale bars 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male specimens from New Caledonia have consistently fewer articles (four articles) in the flagellum of antenna 2 than material originally described by Myers (1985) from the Fijian Islands (six articles).

Found in coral rubble, seagrasses, macroalgae, sponges, red algae, branching coral
Pocillopora sp.
, green calcareous alga
Halimeda sp.
, brown algae
Turbinaria sp.
and
Sargassum sp.
